sense.name: act of commerce
sense.commentary: TRANSACTION[+event] The act of buying or selling, or otherwise conducting some business or commercial transaction. Refers to specific acts, not a general concept.
sense.examples: The transaction occurred in a dark alley at midnight. I'd like to begin conducting some transactions with my bank. I had to pay a transaction tax when I bought all the bonds. John completed the transaction by paying his cashier.

sense.name: general commercial activity
sense.commentary: The general concept of carrying on commercial activities. Cannot conceivably refer to a specific instance of buying or selling.
sense.examples: Lowering the interest rate can increase the rate of transaction in the stock market.
